author: mkellerman
body:
Many modules exists out there to allow Throttling of parallel jobs/tasks. And the main reasons people use them are for simple throttling of tasks. 

Ex: 
````
$Computers = Get-Content 'computers.txt'
Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock { 
    Param($Computer) 
    Test-Connection $Computer
} -ThrottleLimit 5 -ArgumentList $Computers
````

Do I really need to enable Powershell Remoting to execute this simple task? 

If it's impossible to do with Invoke-Command, I would suggest adding ThrottleLimit to Start-Job.

comments.author: mkellerman
SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @mkellerman as @iSazonov pointed out, `Start-ThreadJob` has a `-ThrottleLimit` parameter.  `Start-Job` probably should have it as well...  As you noticed, `Invoke-Command` has `-ThottleLimit` when used with remoting which makes sense.  You could point `Invoke-Command` to localhost, but I think `Start-ThreadJob` is a much better existing solution.

comments.author: mkellerman
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT Ahhhh, my bad. I didn't know it was part of a new release.. I saw this GitHub project (https://github.com/PaulHigin/PSThreadJob) and thought it was an external module we had to install.

Cheers!

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @mkellerman `ThreadJob` is included with PSCore6.1, but can optionally be installed for Windows PowerShell and PSCore6.0

title: Enable Invoke-Command -ThrottleLimit to be used on localhost without remote connection.
